e4: I recommend changing to the new policy to enhance transparency and align with ethical financial reporting practices. While it may cause short-term confusion among some investors, adopting an unbiased reporting approach fosters trust and accountability. This change could ultimately strengthen investor confidence and mitigate potential legal risks in the long run, supporting sustainable growth for the company.
e5: An ethical reporting policy should prioritize transparency, accuracy, and consistency in financial disclosures. It should clearly communicate the true financial health of the company without misleading stakeholders, regardless of their level of expertise. Additionally, it must comply with regulatory standards and consider the impact on all investors, promoting a level playing field while fostering trust in the financial markets.
e6: Yes, I would like to ask how the management team plans to educate investors about the change in reporting policy to ensure they understand the implications. Additionally, what measures will be taken to address any potential backlash from retail investors who may be caught off guard by adjusted earnings reporting?
